title: Ticket #676: User can give GRAM5 hint to Condor-G
description: The gridmanager needs to be able to distinguish between GRAM2 and GRAM5 servers. This won't be able to make it into the 7.3.2 release, but we can add code allowing the user to tell the gridmanager whether a server is GRAM5. They can do this by setting the grid-type to 'gt5' in the GridResource job attribute.
remarks:
2009-Aug-19 16:07:31 by jfrey:
The 'gt5' grid-type is intended as a temporary solution to distinguishing between GRAM2 and GRAM5 servers. Currently, the GridResource or GridJobId attribute of the first job seen by the gridmanager for a given server determines whether it treats the server as GRAM2 or GRAM5. So mixing the two grid-types for a given server results in undefined behavior.

If a server is ID'd as GRAM5, the gridmanager's behavior towards that server is changed as follows:

  • Grid Monitor is disabled.
  • Jobmanagers aren't stopped.
  • GRIDMANAGER_MAX_JOBMANAGERS_PER_RESOURCE isn't applied.
